com.percussion.services.sitemgr
Interface IPSSiteManager

All Superinterfaces:
IPSCataloger
All Known Subinterfaces:
IPSSiteManagerInternal
public interface IPSSiteManager
extends IPSCataloger

Initial basic site manager to allow the loading of site and site specific information. This will be filled out in a later release, but here is a read-only interface.

Important to use this manager and dereference related site objects, you must be in the same Session, so this should be called from within another manager.

At this point the site manager does not offer cataloging services.

Author:
dougrand

Create and initialize a new location scheme. It is not persisted, you must call saveScheme(IPSLocationScheme) to persist it to permanent storage.

Returns:
a new scheme, never null

loadScheme

IPSLocationScheme loadScheme(IPSGuid schemeId)
                             throws com.percussion.services.error.PSNotFoundException
Load a cached location scheme by ID if it exists in cached; otherwise load the location scheme from the repository, save it into cache, then return the cached object. The return object cannot be saved by calling saveScheme(IPSLocationScheme).

Parameters:
schemeId - the scheme's ID, never null.
Returns:
the cached location scheme, never null
Throws:
com.percussion.services.error.PSNotFoundException - if the scheme is not found

Parameters:

Returns:
the loaded location scheme, never null. This object can be saved by saveScheme(IPSLocationScheme).
Throws:
com.percussion.services.error.PSNotFoundException - if the scheme is not found

getPublishPath

String getPublishPath(IPSGuid siteId,
                      IPSGuid folderId)
                      throws PSSiteManagerException
Gets a publishing path for the specified site and folder. This path is constructed with the publishing name of the folders, which is either the property of 'sys_pubFilename' of the folder (if exists) or the name of the folder (if 'sys_pubFilename' property does not exist).

Parameters:
siteId - the id of the specified site, never null.
folderId - the id of the specified folder, never null. It must be a folder under the root folder of the specified site.
Returns:
the publishing path. It is relative to the root folder of the specified site, and is in the form of "/a/b/c/", where 'a' is the immediate child folder of the site root folder, 'b' the child folder of 'a', and 'c' is the publishing name of the specified folder. It is "/" if the specified folder is the root folder of the specified site. It is null if cannot find the root folder of the site or the root folder of the site is not defined.
Throws:
PSSiteManagerException - if an error occurs while looking up the path.

getSiteFolderId

IPSGuid getSiteFolderId(IPSGuid siteId,
                        IPSGuid contentId)
                        throws PSSiteManagerException
Find and return the folder id that the given item is contained in for a given site. If the item is in more than one folder, this returns the first found.

Parameters:
siteId - the site guid, never null
contentId - the content guid, never null
Returns:
the id of the parent folder in the given site or null if no match can be found
Throws:
PSSiteManagerException

getItemSites

List<IPSSite> getItemSites(IPSGuid contentId)
                           throws PSSiteManagerException
Find and return all the sites the item exists in. The sites are ordered by the name of the sites it exists in.

Parameters:
contentId - the content guid, never null
Returns:
the sites the item exists in never null may be empty, if the item does not exist in any site.
Throws:
PSSiteManagerException

isContentTypePublishableToSite

boolean isContentTypePublishableToSite(IPSGuid contentTypeId,
                                       IPSGuid siteId)
                                       throws PSSiteManagerException
Check if the content type with supplied GUID is publishable to the specified site. This is done by checking if at least one template for the content type is registered to publish for the supplied site.

Parameters:
contentTypeId - GUID of the content item to check, must not be null.
siteId - GUID of the site to check, may be null in which case the check will be done against all sites in the system and returns true even if any of the sites can publish any of the item's templates.
Returns:
true if the content type is publishable to the supplied site or any site if supplied site is null
Throws:
PSSiteManagerException

loadUnmodifiableSite

IPSSite loadUnmodifiableSite(IPSGuid siteid)
                             throws com.percussion.services.error.PSNotFoundException
Load a site instance using an in-memory cache if possible. The returned object will be accessible from multiple threads, and so should not be modified or used with the saveSite(IPSSite) method. See loadSite(IPSGuid) for more information.

Parameters:
siteid - the id of the object to retrieve, never null
Returns:
the site, never null
Throws:
com.percussion.services.error.PSNotFoundException - if cannot find the site.

findAllContexts

List<IPSPublishingContext> findAllContexts()
Find all the available publishing contexts.

Returns:
the available publishing contexts, never null and never empty on a normal system. A list is returned for the convenience of the caller, no order is guaranteed.

findAllSchemes

List<IPSLocationScheme> findAllSchemes()
Find all the available location schemes.

Returns:
the available location schemes, never null. A list is returned for the convenience of the caller, no order is guaranteed.

findDistinctSiteVariableNames

List<String> findDistinctSiteVariableNames()
Find all the unique names for site variables. Used to aid in the user interface.

Returns:
the in use site variable names, never null.

deleteContext

void deleteContext(IPSPublishingContext context)
Delete the given publishing context. Has no effect if the context does not exist in the database.

Parameters:
context - the publishing context to delete, never null.

saveContext

void saveContext(IPSPublishingContext context)
Save the given publishing context if the context has never been saved, otherwise updates the context in the database.

Parameters:
context - the publishing context to save, never null.

findSchemesByContextId

List<IPSLocationScheme> findSchemesByContextId(IPSGuid contextid)
Find all schemes associated with the given context id.

Parameters:
contextid - the context id
Returns:
the associated schemes, may be empty if the context id doesn't exist or if there are no associated schemes.

createContext

IPSPublishingContext createContext()
Create and initialize a new context. It is not persisted, you must call saveContext(IPSPublishingContext) to persist it to permanent storage.

Returns:
a new context, never null.

getContextNameMap

Map<Integer,String> getContextNameMap()
Returns:
a map associating the integer values for a context and the context name, never null.
